text: Hong Kong has a complex transport network. It includes both public and private transport. Over 90% of the daily use is on public transport. That is the highest rate in the world.Lam, William H.K. [2003] (2003). Advanced Modeling for Transit Operations and Service Planning. Elsevier publishing. The Octopus card is an electronic money system. It became available in September 1997. Passengers can use it in every station of the Mass Transit Railway (MTR) system. The card can be used to pay for public transport, parking meters, convenience stores, supermarkets, fast-food restaurants and most vending machines. ==Related pages== * MTR * Octopus card ==References== ==Other websites== *Wang L H, "In Search of a Sustainable Transport Development Strategy for Hong Kong" *Hong Kong Highways Department *Hong Kong Transport Department *Vehicular tunnels in Hong Kong *E & E Bus *Transport Statistics â€“ Census and Statistics Department
